channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver coded package as damage on 4/10, package was found again on 4/11. Package was put to side to minimize any further damage. DescribePack: Upon inspection, a cylinder was found inside of package with the bottom cracked, causing contents to spill out. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Place in clear hazmat bag to mitigate spillage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered damp and crushed upon being unloaded from the trailer. QA was informed of its condition and location. DescribePack: The seal to one bottle was broken, causing some liquid to leak out and soak one corner of the outer box. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined hazmat tote and taken to the nearest QA cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040832
item.description:
Report X-2024040832

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA on 4/9/24 by driver who stated that they could smell alcohol and noticed that the package was wet. Once QA received package and opened it, they noticed that one of the bottles had a loose cap and that caused the product to spill out onto the box and other 3 bottles. No clean up due to it being isopropanol alcohol and it just spilled out onto the box and the other 3 bottles. DescribePack: Cap was loose. Not fully secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once package was opened by QA the cap was tightened to prevent product from leaking any further.

item.title: Report E-2024040391
item.description:
Report E-2024040391

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: LA GRANGE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING UNLOADING OPERATIONS, THE DRIVER HAD TO SWITCH HOSES BECAUSE OF A BAD GASKET IN THE HOSE. WHILE DRIVER WAS DICONNECTING THE HOSE THAT WAS UNDER SOME PRESSURE CAUSED PRODUCT TO SPRAY OUT OF THE HOSE AND ONTO THE GROUND. NEW HOSE WAS CONNECTED AND UNLOADING OPERATIONS WERE COMPLETED WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT. PLANT PERSONNELL CLEAND UP SPILL.

item.title: Report X-2024040463
item.description:
Report X-2024040463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off of truck in Unload notably wet, was placed into lined tote immediately and moved to safe area. Unable to determine if this occurred when initially loaded to trailer or during transit to our station. Upon opening outer packaging found one of four 4L bottles of water (non-hazardous) had somehow broken during shipping causing water to release inside package and eventually seep out as well. DescribePack: There were corrugated moldings around each of the four bottles to help protect during shipping but evidently was not enough to keep one bottle from getting broken. When that happened water leaked out inside, compromising structural integrity of inner, outer packaging and causing the box/moldings to tear and distort due to weight of 3 non-broken bottles. Bottle was already broken coming off of trailer so no knowledge of what directly caused damage to occur. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Water had already leaked out due to bottle being broken completely. Cleaned up all wet areas in trailer and unload to re-establish safe working environment. Thankfully as stated through this report, the box was labeled as a Hazmat but did not contain any hazardous contents. Not sure if it was a mix-up by shipper when assigning labels to packages or what cause was, but no hazardous contents were in package or leaked out.
